page.title: 16A SHEPHERD'S YEAR
page.content: A shepherds year starts in October. October Intensive feeding of the ewes begins. November The rams serve the ewes. Takes about 6 weeks to cover the whole flock. December to February. The ewes con- tinue to be fed. March to April. Lambing takes place. Extra help needed. Day and night work. May Feeding and general health care of ewes and lambs. June Injections of lambs. Worming. Shearing. Dipping (at Hockly) June to August. Ewes and lambs out to pasture. Fence repairing and general maintainance. September Start feeding hay. Sheep are usually dipped twice a year. Fleeces are trimmed as necessary for cleanliness and hooves trimmed.
